textBeforeTable: The donation has now been recorded, and the details of the donation are now displayed. The following options are available from the donation details screen: Click the Save button. Complete any custom donation fields that were added to the donation form. Enter any comments or notes regarding the donation. Optionally, choose a tender method – the way in which the donation payment was received. Select the date of the donation. Enter the amount of the donation. From the Add Donation screen that appears, click the Select existing contact button and select the contact who made the donation. Click the Record donation button. Go to the Donations module. To manually record a donation, follow these steps: For instructions on setting up a donation page so visitors to your site can make a donation online, see Donation forms. Administrators can manually record a donation received from a contact, whether the payment was made by cash, cheque, credit card, PayPal, or any other tender method. Manually recording a donation You can embed a Wild Apricot donation form into another website using widgets. Icon To track the success of your fundraising efforts, you can add a donation goal
textAfterTable: Displaying donations You can display a list of individual donations, a list of donors, or all the individual donations for a particular donor. Displaying individual donations To display a list of individual donations, click the Donations menu. From the Donation module, you'll see a list of donations in chronological order. The list includes donations made through a donation form on your website and donations recorded manually by an administrator. Multiple donations by the same donor are recorded separately. For each donation, the following information is displayed: Column Description Date Date of the donation, plus payment details for online payments or any internal notes recorded by the administrator. Number Donation receipt number. Donor Donor's name and email. Tender How the donation payment was made. See Payment tenders. Amount The amount of the donation. You filter the donations list by clicking the Filter box and selecting a filter... ...or by entering a search string in the Search field.
